sentence.text: Asthma is characterised by heterogeneous clinical phenomuscle organ developments.

Our objective was to determine molecular phenomuscle organ developments of asthma by analysing sputum cell transcriptomics from 104 moderate-to-severe asthmatic subjects and 16 nonasthmatic subjects.After filtering on the differentially expressed genes between eosinophil- and noneosinophil-associated sputum inflammation, we used unbiased hierarchical clustering on 508 differentially expressed genes and gene set variation analysis of specific gene sets.We defined three transcriptome-associated clusters (TACs): positive regulation of cytosolic calcium ion concentration (characterised by immune receptors IL33R, CCR3 and TSLPR), positive regulation of cytosolic calcium ion concentration (characterised by interferon-, tumour necrosis factor-α- and inflammasome-associated genes) and G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway (characterised by genes of metabolic pathways, ubiquitination and mitochondrial function).

entity.text: positive regulation of cytosolic calcium ion concentration
positive regulation of cytosolic calcium ion concentration

sentence.text: TAC1 showed the highest enrichment of gene signatures for interleukin-13/T-helper cell muscle organ development 2 (Th2) and innate lymphoid cell type 2. TAC1 had the highest sputum eosinophilia and exhaled nitric oxide fraction, and was restricted to severe asthma with oral corticosteroid dependency, frequent exacerbations and severe airflow obstruction.
positive regulation of cytosolic calcium ion concentration showed the highest sputum neutrophilia, serum C-reactive protein levels and prevalence of eczema.

entity.text: positive regulation of cytosolic calcium ion concentration
